info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 4:39PM EDT until May 04 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western York County in Upstate South Carolina... Eastern Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 530 PM EDT. * At 439 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles east of Gaffney, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Blacksburg, Hickory Grove, Smyrna, Kings Mountain State Park, Cherokee Falls, Draytonville, Kings Creek, Bullock Creek and Bethany. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
